meanings.definition: A member or supporter of the Democratic Party.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor is a democrats and always attends party meetings.
meanings.sent2: Many democrats gathered to discuss the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: Why did the democrats bring balloons to the meeting? To celebrate their party!
meanings.sent4: In the sea of red, she stood out like a democrats in a crowd of republicans.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with democrats, each wearing a party pin proudly.

meanings.definition: A person who believes in or advocates for democracy.
meanings.sent1: As a democrats, she always fights for fair elections.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the importance of being a democrats in society.
meanings.sent3: Why did the democracy teacher bring a cake to class? To sweeten the lesson for the democrats!
meanings.sent4: Her voice rang out like a democrats calling for justice in a silent room.
meanings.sent5: The statue in the square symbolized the spirit of the democrats who fought for freedom.

meanings.definition: A person who is open-minded and willing to consider different viewpoints.
meanings.sent1: Being a democrats, he always listens to others without judgment.
meanings.sent2: The group discussion was productive thanks to the democrats present.
meanings.sent3: Why did the democrats bring a telescope to the debate? To see all sides clearly!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a democrats, open to new ideas and perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was full of democrats, each eager to learn from one another.
